subject: Configurations: Bletchley: Update AspeedFan
commitMessage:
Configurations: Bletchley: Update AspeedFan

Add AspeedFan into Chassis (FAN0 - FAN3)
Bletchley has 4 dual rotor fan modules.
Both TACH in same fan module connect to same PWM

  PWN-FANX
    |--> FANX_TACH_IL
    |--> FANX_TACH_OL

this commit relies on dbus-sensors change (49253)
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/dbus-sensors/+/49253

Signed-off-by: Potin Lai <potin.lai@quantatw.com>
Change-Id: I933957549339f3b143ad0f7979f809e5a58887ef

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.

Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

I know this is waiting on code in dbus-sensors and the kernel, but is there any reason we can't get the EM config added now?  (Maybe remove WIP on this?)

Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

This change is ready for review.

Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1
> 
> I know this is waiting on code in dbus-sensors and the kernel, but is there any reason we can't get the EM config added now?  (Maybe remove WIP on this?)

Considering that the naming of the Type will likely change in the dbus-sensors commit (given that "AspeedPwmFan" isn't a very clear name about the difference when compared to "AspeedFan"), I'd rather not commit code that we know is going to have to change, although I'm happy to have the WIP removed here, and we can talk about it.

Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 52f56096fe5465055b5ade2ca678a46850ebce22

this commit relies on dbus-sensors change (49253)
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/dbus-sensors/+/49253
List this in your commit message please.
Done

There are two named "System Fan Connector 0".  Is this intentional?

Seems like the JSON format is just redundant when there are multiple tachs.
switch to BindConnector
Still we have two "System Fan Connector 0" rt?

Each fan module has 2 tachs, and connect to same pwm.

PWM_X
 |--> FANX_TACH_IL
 |--> FANX_TACH_OL
commented this same thing later.  Having two bind connector instances with the same name doesn't seem right.
Done - updated in PS8
The fans always spin even when power is off?
We typically run our fans at a low speed even at standby.
ACK
Done

Generally BindConnector is used on a Chassis component, given that generally the fans are on the chassis, not directly on the motherboard.  As-is, this is going to apply ownership of the fans to the motherboard, which I'm pretty sure isn't what you intended.
Thanks, I will add configuration for Chassis and move fan to there.
Done - updated in PS8
You're binding two different fans to the same connector?  That seems odd.  is there a good reason for that?

We total has 8 fan tachs reading(each fan module has 2 rotors) shared with 4 PWMs.
I also found that there is similar setting in existing configurations.
 - configurations/R1000 Chassis.json (fan)
 - configurations/WFT Baseboard.json (connector)

Will this setting can cause any problems? Any suggested method in this case?
Done
This probe statement seems redundant, considering this is already covered by the Bletchley Baseboard probe statement.  I suspect the Found is the only thing you need.
Done
I made the (untested) change that I think you need.
Please help to review and make sure it works when you test it, then this patchset looks good to go.
Tested with PS13, it works well.
